Description: Fragment of sub-round handle of a Rhodian pottery transport amphora from neck join to sharpish turn. Clay fine pink-buff; cream slip. Rectangular stamp with Helios head symbol.
Production date: 170 BC (see N. Badoud, Le temps de Rhodes, 2015, 142.)
Curator's comments: Petrie Diary (EES Archive XVII 47) p. 55, 35. Name Athanodotos. From same die as Alexandria, Greco-Roman Museum, MGR 0040.16.
Bibliographic references: Villing et al 2013-2015 / Naukratis: Greeks in Egypt (JB.0913)
